item.title: TOPOS 2025: King Britt presents Liberation Meditations: A Call at EMPAC | Aug. 28
item.description: Date: Thursday, August 28, 2025 9:00 PM - 39 speakers. 1 immersive ritual. Visionary producer and sonic explorer King Britt returns with a powerful spatial sound experience unfolding within EMPAC’s state-of-the-art Studio 1—Goodman. Featuring collaborators Suzi Analogue and Myles Ortiz-Green, their performances weave turntables, analog synths, and digital textures into a ritual of rhythm and healing.
item.author: Students

item.title: Second showing! Persepolis: Troy 2025 by Iannis Xenakis x Micah Silver | Aug. 30
item.description: Date: Saturday, August 30, 2025 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM - Experience a seminal work of 20th-century sound art—reframed as an immersive 55-minute installation-performance. Composed in 1971 for a ritual performance amid the ruins of the ancient city of Persepolis, Iran, this eight-channel work invoked fire, movement, and night sky as a sonic act of resistance. At EMPAC, it resounds in a different kind of temple—one built not to glorify power, but to listen. No stage. No performers. Just you and the…

item.title: TOPOS 2025 presents rare screening of Xenakis: Portrait (1971–72) | Aug. 30
item.description: Date: Saturday, August 30, 2025 1:30 PM - 2:30 PM - A spectacle of sound and light, Greek composer Iannis Xenakis’s epic work Persépolis originally took place in the ruins of the Temple of Darius in the Iranian desert on August 26, 1971. Reimagined for TOPOS by Micah Silver, Persépolis becomes a magmatic mass of noise, snaking its way across a multitude of discrete audio channels. All are invited to join us for this FREE screening of Pierre Andregui’s documentary shedding light on the strange…

item.title: CMDIS Facilities Open House | Sept. 3 Sign up by Aug. 29
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM - Center for Materials, Devices and Integrated Systems (CMDIS) invites you to the Facilities Open House. Sign-up for facility tours to learn about new acquisitions, tools, instrumentation capabilities, fabrication and characterization techniques. Get information about educational programs and short courses. Meet with our technical team and discuss how we can help your research. The event will be followed by BBQ. Sign-up to tours by 08/29.

item.title: RPI Women’s Soccer Pre-Game Tailgate, East Campus Athletic Village | Aug. 29
item.description: Date: 8/29/2025 1:00 PM to 3:30 PM We’re excited to kick off the 2025 season with a Pre-Game Tailgate and hope you’ll join us for a fun and casual afternoon before rooting on RPIWS as we take on Suffolk University! Current and former families, alumnae, and friends of RPIWS are invited! This is a great chance to meet new families, reconnect with old, and celebrate the start of another exciting season. We’ll have food, games, music, and plenty of team spirit. Let’s Go Red!

item.title: GEM Student Fall Kick-Off
item.description: Join us Friday, August 29 in Sage 3510 from 4:30pm-7:30pm. The Games and Experiential Media Department will be holding a fall kick-off event to welcome new and returning majors, featuring pizza, vintage console games, party games, board games, miniature war-gaming, and a marathon of the campiest video game movies and shows of all time. All GEM and CGD students and alumni are welcome!

item.title: Fire Evacuation Drills to be Conducted in Residential Buildings
item.description: Fire evacuation drills will take place in residential buildings during the first two weeks of the fall semester. These unannounced drills are required by New York State Fire Code and provide residents an opportunity to practice safe evacuation procedures.
